morpion

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • morpion.Controller

  • class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Is responsible for the realisation of the application use cases (and so the synchronization between the entity and the view)
    Author:
    Tommy 'Motyak'

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        Controller(View view,
           Ent ent)
    throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
           java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        view - the main interface
        ent - the entity(ies)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case there is a problem writing files in the user directory or writing/reading the ai model file
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - in case the serialized object doesn't match the ai model class

    • Method Detail

      • launchLearning

        public void launchLearning()
        Launch the learning task in a thread

      • submitMove

        public boolean submitMove(int id)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Check if the submitted move is possible, if so, play it and check on win
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the square in the grid (0,1,2, 3,4,5, 6,7,8)
        Returns:
        true if the move is possible, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the file storing the moves cannot be found

      • changeMode

        Change the game mode
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode to apply

                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Change the game difficulty
        Parameters:
        diff - the difficulty to apply
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the file storing the configuration cannot be found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - in case the serialized object doesn't match the ai model class

        private boolean checkOnWin()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Check if the game is ended, if so, check if there is a winner and deal with it
        Returns:
        true if the game ended, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the moves file doesn't exist or cannot be written
